samophis.lavalink.client.entities

Class LavaClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • samophis.lavalink.client.entities.LavaClient

  • public abstract class LavaClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the LavaClient implementation of Lavalink, with default constants matching those of the Lavalink-Server, collections of nodes, players, etc.
    This is the gateway into every other LavaClient action and can be constructed with a LavaClientBuilder.
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    SamOphis

public abstract LavaHttpManager getHttpManager()
        Used to fetch the LavaHttpManager associated with this client, which is used to get track data from an identifier.
        Returns:
        The LavaHttpManager used to grab track data from an identifier.

      • getNodeByIdentifier

        @Nullable
public abstract AudioNode getNodeByIdentifier(@Nonnull
                                                         java.lang.String address,
                                                         @Nonnegative
                                                         int websocketPort)
        Fetches an AudioNode by address and port. This operation is extremely fast as it only looks up the entry in a HashMap.
        Parameters:
        address - The not-null server address specified in the node's AudioNodeEntry.
        websocketPort - The positive server WebSocket port specified in the node's AudioNodeEntry.
        Returns:
        A possibly-null AudioNode associated with the provided server address and WebSocket port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided address was null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided WebSocket Port was negative.

      • getPlayerByGuildId

        @Nullable
public abstract LavaPlayer getPlayerByGuildId(@Nonnegative
                                                         long guild_id)
        Fetches a LavaPlayer instance by Guild ID.

        This method will return null if a player for the provided Guild ID doesn't exist, unlike previous versions of LavaClient.

        Parameters:
        guild_id - The positive ID of the Guild.
        Returns:
        A possibly-null LavaPlayer instance associated with the Guild ID.

      • getGlobalServerPassword

        @Nonnull
public abstract java.lang.String getGlobalServerPassword()
        Fetches the default password for all AudioNodes the client has access to.

        This value equates to "youshallnotpass" if it's not specified during the construction of the LavaClient instance.

        Returns:
        The default password specified for this LavaClient instance.

      • getCacheExpireAfterWriteMs

        @Nonnegative
public abstract long getCacheExpireAfterWriteMs()
        Fetches the amount of time from which track data will be removed from the cache after being written without being accessed.

        When a song loads, LavaClient caches the initial loading data temporarily so that the server nor the client have to re-load it for a certain period of time.
        This value tells LavaClient how long to wait after data is written before it is removed, ignoring the access of the data.
        If the data is not removed, memory usage will keep on going up which is bad for big bots or small bots on limited hardware.

        This value equates to 1200000L milliseconds if it isn't manually specified during construction of the client.

        Returns:
        The amount of time to wait to remove cached track data after it is initially written.
        See Also:
        getCacheExpireAfterAccessMs()

      • getCacheExpireAfterAccessMs

        @Nonnegative
public abstract long getCacheExpireAfterAccessMs()
        Fetches the amount of time from which track data will removed from the cache after being accessed (after being written).

        When a song loads, LavaClient caches the initial loading data temporarily so that the server nor the client have to re-load it for a certain period of time.
        This value tells LavaClient how long to wait after data is accessed before it is removed, ignoring the writing of the data.
        If the data is not removed, memory usage will slowly creep up which is bad for big bots or small bots on limited hardware.

        This value equates to 900000L milliseconds if it isn't manually specified during construction of the client.

        Returns:
        The amount of time to wait to remove cached track data after it is accessed.
        See Also:
        getCacheExpireAfterWriteMs()

      • getGlobalWebSocketPort

        @Nonnegative
public abstract int getGlobalWebSocketPort()
        Fetches the default WebSocket port for all AudioNodes the client has access to.

        This value equates to 80 if it's not specified during the construction of the LavaClient instance.

        Returns:
        The default WebSocket port for this LavaClient instance.

      • getGlobalRestPort

        @Nonnegative
public abstract int getGlobalRestPort()
        Fetches the default REST API port for all AudioNodes the client has access to.

        This value equates to 2333 if it's not specified during the construction of the LavaClient instance.

        Returns:
        The default REST API port for this LavaClient instance.

      • getShardCount

        @Nonnegative
public abstract int getShardCount()
        Fetches the amount of shards specified during the construction of the LavaClient instance.
        Returns:
        The amount of shards LavaClient is aware of and passes to AudioNodes when connecting.

      • getUserId

        @Nonnegative
public abstract long getUserId()
        Fetches the User ID of the Bot User specified during the construction of the LavaClient instance.
        Returns:
        The User ID of the Bot User which LavaClient passes to AudioNodes when connecting.

      • addNode

        public abstract void addNode(@Nonnull
                             AudioNode node)
        Adds a not-null AudioNode and opens a connection to it (if it isn't already open).

        Note: This will overwrite and disconnect the client from the node if it pre-exists with the same information.

        Parameters:
        node - The not-null AudioNode to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided node was null.

      • removeNode

        public abstract void removeNode(@Nonnull
                                AudioNode node)
        Attempts to remove a not-null AudioNode.

        If no node was found with the attached information, no action will be performed. Additionally, if one was found the client will disconnect from it and then remove it from the global map.

        Parameters:
        node - The not-null AudioNode to remove.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided AudioNode was null.

      • addEntry

        public abstract void addEntry(@Nonnull
                              AudioNodeEntry entry)
        Adds a not-null AudioNode and opens a connection to it based on the information provided by the AudioNodeEntry.
        Parameters:
        entry - The AudioNodeEntry containing the address, the port, etc. of the AudioNode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided entry was null.

      • removeEntry

        public abstract void removeEntry(@Nonnull
                                 AudioNodeEntry entry)
        Attempts to remove the AudioNode associated with the provided, not-null AudioNodeEntry.

        This will do nothing if no node was found, and it'll disconnect the client from the node and remove it if it was found.

        Parameters:
        entry - The not-null AudioNodeEntry used to identify and remove the associated AudioNode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided AudioNodeEntry was null.

      • removeEntry

        public abstract void removeEntry(@Nonnull
                                 java.lang.String serverAddress,
                                 @Nonnegative
                                 int websocketPort)
        Attempts to remove the AudioNode associated with a provided server address and port.

        This will do nothing if no node was found, and it'll disconnect the client from the node and remove it if it was found.

        Parameters:
        serverAddress - The not-null raw address of the server without any scheme behind it.
        websocketPort - The not-negative WebSocket port of the Lavalink Server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided server address was null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided WebSocket port was negative.

      • getIdentifierCache

        @Nonnull
public abstract com.github.benmanes.caffeine.cache.Cache<java.lang.String,TrackDataPair> getIdentifierCache()
        Fetches the internal identifier cache used by LavaClient to cut down the impact of loading the same sources in quick succession.

        Note: Editing this cache might cause some delay and bugs. Modifying it is your choice.

        Returns:
        the internal cache LavaClient uses to cut down repeated song loading impact.

      • getPlayerMap

        @Nonnull
public abstract it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.longs.Long2ObjectMap<LavaPlayer> getPlayerMap()
        Fetches an unmodifiable view of the internal player map.

        Note: This returns an unmodifiable map, meaning any attempts to modify it will throw exceptions.

        Returns:
        An unmodifiable view of the internal player map.

      • newPlayer

        @Nonnull
public abstract LavaPlayer newPlayer(@Nullable
                                               AudioNode node,
                                               @Nonnegative
                                               long guild_id)
        Fetches a not-null LavaPlayer instance associated with a positive Guild ID.

        If a player is already found, it'll simply be returned. If one doesn't exist, it'll be created but NOT connected.
        In this sense, a new player doesn't submit a Voice Update to an AudioNode manually. Use an EventWaiter wherever you can instead of manually creating new players.

        Parameters:
        node - The possibly-null AudioNode to set. Replaced with the best available node if this is null.
        guild_id - The positive ID of the Guild to connect to.
        Returns:
        A not-null LavaPlayer instance.

      • newPlayer

        @Nonnull
public abstract LavaPlayer newPlayer(@Nonnegative
                                               long guild_id)
        Fetches a not-null LavaPlayer instance associated with a positive Guild ID.

        If a player is already found, it'll simply be returned. If one doesn't exist, it'll be created but NOT connected.
        In this sense, a new player doesn't submit a Voice Update to an AudioNode manually. Use an EventWaiter wherever you can instead of manually creating new players.

        Parameters:
        guild_id - The positive ID of the Guild to connect to.
        Returns:
        A not-null LavaPlayer instance.

      • removePlayer

        @Nullable
public abstract LavaPlayer removePlayer(@Nonnegative
                                                   long guild_id,
                                                   boolean shouldDestroy)
        Attempts to remove a LavaPlayer instance associated with a positive Guild ID.

        If a player is found, it'll be removed and disconnected only if it's connected and if shouldDestroy is set to true. If it isn't found, nothing will happen and null will be returned.

        Parameters:
        guild_id - The positive Guild ID associated with the LavaPlayer instance.
        shouldDestroy - If LavaClient should destroy the player before removing it.
        Returns:
        A possibly-null LavaPlayer instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided Guild ID was negative.

      • removePlayer

        public abstract LavaPlayer removePlayer(@Nonnegative
                                        long guild_id)
        Attempts to remove a LavaPlayer instance associated with a positive Guild ID.

        If a player is found, it'll simply be removed without anything else happening. If it isn't found, nothing will happen and null will be returned.

        Parameters:
        guild_id - The positive Guild ID associated with the LavaPlayer instance.
        Returns:
        A possibly-null LavaPlayer instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided Guild ID was negative.

      • shutdown

        public abstract void shutdown()
        Shuts down LavaClient (also resetting the state).

        This method removes and disconnects from all AudioNodes and LavaPlayers and additionally shuts down the attached LavaHttpManager.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this client has already been shutdown.

      • getBestNode

        @Nullable
public abstract AudioNode getBestNode()
        Fetches the AudioNode with the least amount of load on it, used to balance the load of LavaPlayers on different nodes.
        Returns:
        The best AudioNode to connect to, returns null if no node exists or is available.
